# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Sure, I can help with that. Here's how you might define such a function in Julia:

```julia
function clean_column(col) 
    return replace(replace(lowercase(strip(col)), " " => "_"), "-" => "_")
end
```
This function works by first converting the column name to lower case, removing any leading or trailing whitespace using `strip`, replacing spaces with underscores using `replace`, and finally replacing hyphens with underscores. 

You can test this function like so:

```julia
julia> clean_column("My Column")
"my_column"
```
